head.title: Metro Briefing | New York: Bronx: Bribery Charges At Co-Op City

hedline.hl1: Metro Briefing | New York: Bronx: Bribery Charges At Co-Op City

block.p: The former president of the board of the Co-op City housing complex was charged yesterday with participating in a bribery scheme related to a $3.5 million painting contract, federal prosecutors said. The former president, Iris Herskowitz Baez, 59, was charged in Federal District Court with bribery and conspiracy, said Michael J. Garcia, the United States attorney in Manhattan. Ms. Baez served as president and then secretary to the board from 2000 to 2003, prosecutors said. She has pleaded not guilty.
